sp.l: My partis the worst,but since you alhere on agree.
Go euen to master Bayly, let it be so for mee,

sp.speaker: Bayly
sp.l: How saiest thou diccon, art content this shal on me depend

sp.speaker: Diccon
sp.l: Go to M. Bayly say on your mind, I know ye are my frend?

sp.speaker: Bayly
sp.l: Then marke ye wel, to recompence this thy former action
Because thou hast offended al, to make them satisfaction,
Before their faces, here kneele downe, & as I shal the teach
For thou shalt take on othe, of hodges leather breache
First for master Doctor, wpon paine of his cursse,
Where he wil pay for al, thou neuer draw thy pursse,
And when ye meete at one pot, he shal haue the first Pull,
And thou shalt neuer offer him the cup, but it be full
To goodwife chat thou shalt be swome, euen on the same wyse
If she refuse thy inoney once, neuer to offer it twise.
Thou shalt be bound by the same here, as thou dost take it
When thou maist drinke of free cost, thou neuer forsake it.
For gammer gurtons sake, againe sworne shalt hou bee
To helpe hir to hir nedle againe if it do lie in thee
And hkewise be bouind: by the vertue of that
To be of good abering to Gib hir great Cat
Last of al for Hodge, the othe to scanne,
Thou shalt neuer take him, for fine gentleman.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Come on fellow Diccon chalbe euen with thee now.

sp.speaker: Bayly
sp.l: Thou wilt not sticke to do this Diccon I trow.

sp.speaker: Diccon
sp.l: No by my fathers skin, my hand downe I lay it?
Loke as I haue promised, I wil not denay it,
But Hodge take good heede now, thou do not beshite me.

div.stage: And gaue him a good blow on the buttocke.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Gogs hart thou false villame dost thou bite me?

sp.speaker: Bayly
sp.l: What Hodge doth he hurt the or euer he begin.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: He thrust me into the buttocke, with a bodkin or a pin,
I saie Gammer, Gammer?

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: How now Hodge, how now.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Gods malt Gammer gurton.

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: Thou art inad ich trow.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Will you see the deuil Gammer.

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: The deuil sonne, god blesse vs.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Chould iche were hanged Gammer.

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: Mary so ye might dresse vs.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Chaue it by the masse Gammer

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: What not my neele Hodge?

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Your Neele Gammer, your neele.

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: No fie, dost but dodge.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Cha found your neele Gammer, here in my hand be it

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: For al the loues on earth Hodge, let me see it.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Soft Gammer.

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: Good Hodge.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Soft ich say, tarie a while.

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: Nay sweete Hodge say truth, and do not me begile.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Cham sure on it ich warrant you [mdash ] it goes no more a stray

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: Hodge when I speake so faire: wilt stil say me nay

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Go neare the light gammer, this wel in faith good lucke:
Chwas almost vndone [mdash ] twas so far in my buttocke

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: Tis min owne deare neele Hodge, sykerly I wot

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Chani I not a good sonne gammer, cham I not,

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: Christs blessing light on thee, hast made me for euer

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Ich knew that ich must finde it, els choud a had it neuer.

sp.speaker: Chat
sp.l: By my troth Gossyp gurton, I am euen as glad
As though I mme owne selfe as good a turne had:.

sp.speaker: Bayly
sp.l: And I by my concience, to see it so come forth,
Reioyce so much at it, as three nedles be worth.

sp.speaker: D. Rat
sp.l: I am no whit sory to see you so reioyce.

sp.speaker: Diccon
sp.l: Nor I much the gladder for al this noyce:
Yet say gramercy Diccon, for springing of the gaine

sp.speaker: Gammer
sp.l: Grammercy Diccon twenty times, o how glad cham,
If that Chould do so much, your masterdome to come hether,
Master Rat, goodwife Chat, and Diccon together:
Cha but one halfpeny, as far as iche know it,
And chil not rest this night, till ich bestow it.
If euer ye loue me, let vs go in and drinke

sp.speaker: Bayly
sp.l: I am content if the rest thmke as I thinke?
Master Rat it shalbe best for you if we so doo,
Then shall you warme you and dresse your self too.

sp.speaker: Diccon
sp.l: Soft syrs, take vs with you, the company shalbe the more,
As proude coms behinde they say, as any goes before,
But now my good masters since we must be gone
And leaue you behinde vs, here all alon:
Since at our last ending thus mery we bee,
For Gammer Gurtons nedle sake, let vs haue a plaudytie.
